answer: Today I built a simple form validation flow in React. Next time I’d improve accessibility by adding proper aria attributes and focus management.
I learned how to use `useMemo` properly. I’d improve by measuring performance before optimizing so I don’t add complexity unnecessarily.
I fixed a bug where a button click wasn’t working because the handler was attached to the wrong element. I verified using console logs and by writing a small UI test.
At first async/await was confusing because I expected code to run top-to-bottom. It clicked when I learned about promises and the event loop.
I’d redesign my routine by doing 30 minutes of problem solving first, then reading docs. Starting with problems shows what I actually don’t understand.
A daily habit: write one small reusable component and document it. It improves consistency and forces you to think clearly about APIs.
